segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And I'm Erica.
segments.cn: 我是Erica。

segments.en: And today we're bringing you another part of our sports series, and today we're going to be talking about volleyball.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来体育系列的另一部分，今天我们要谈论排球。

segments.en: That's right, and we're going all the way to New Zealand to visit the men's volleyball championships.
segments.cn: 没错，我们将前往新西兰，参加男子排球锦标赛。

segments.en: So we're going to be looking at some great words and phrases related to volleyball, and also how to describe a sporting event.
segments.cn: 我们将查看一些与排球相关的精彩词汇和短语，以及如何描述体育赛事。

segments.en: So before we start on the dialogue, let's take a look at two words on Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 在我们开始对话之前，让我们先看一下词汇预览中的两个词。

segments.en: All right, we're going to hear both of these words in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: Now, the first one, encounter.
segments.cn: 第一个词，遭遇。

segments.en: An exciting encounter.
segments.cn: 一场激动人心的遭遇。

segments.en: All right, so if we have an exciting encounter, it means we have an exciting meeting of two people, or two teams, or two groups.
segments.cn: 如果我们有一场激动人心的遭遇，意味着我们有两个人、两支队伍或两个团体的激动人心的会面。

segments.en: If I say I had an incredible encounter last night with my best friend.
segments.cn: 如果我说我昨晚和我最好的朋友有了一次不可思议的遭遇。

segments.en: You met up with your best friend and something happened.
segments.cn: 你和你最好的朋友见面了，发生了一些事情。

segments.en: Okay, so that's what an encounter would mean.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是遭遇的意思。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Looking at our second word now, powerhouse.
segments.cn: 现在来看我们的第二个词，强队。

segments.en: Two powerhouse teams.
segments.cn: 两支强队。

segments.en: All right, so we have two powerhouse teams, China and Brazil.
segments.cn: 没错，我们有两支强队，中国和巴西。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So a powerhouse team is basically a strong, powerful, really energetic, great team, right?
segments.cn: 所以强队基本上是指一支强大、有力、充满活力的优秀团队，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so we can use it for teams, such as in this case, but we can also describe maybe a company or a person as a powerhouse.
segments.cn: 好的，我们可以用它来形容队伍，比如在这种情况下，但我们也可以形容一家公司或一个人是强队。

segments.en: That guy is a powerhouse.
segments.cn: 那个人是个强队。

segments.en: He can lift 500 pounds.
segments.cn: 他能举起500磅。

segments.en: Now I think it's time for us to listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在我想是时候第一次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: We're going to be listening to this great sporting event as we are taken to New Zealand to see China and Brazil play.
segments.cn: 我们将听到这场精彩的体育赛事，带我们去新西兰观看中国和巴西的比赛。

segments.en: It's a beautiful day here in New Zealand at the Men's Volleyball World Championship.
segments.cn: 今天在新西兰男子排球世界锦标赛上是个美丽的日子。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and I'm joined by the man with the plan, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫Rick Fields，身边是计划者Bob Copeland。

segments.en: Thank you, Rick.
segments.cn: 谢谢你，Rick。

segments.en: We've got a very exciting encounter ahead of us today as two powerhouse teams, Brazil and China, face off against each other and try to qualify for the next round.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一场非常激动人心的遭遇，两支强队，巴西和中国，正在对抗并争取晋级下一轮。

segments.en: Without a doubt, both teams are in top shape, and this will prove to be a competitive match.
segments.cn: 毫无疑问，两队状态都很好，这将是一场竞争激烈的比赛。

segments.en: The ref signals the start of the game, and here we go!
segments.cn: 裁判发出比赛开始的信号，开始了！

segments.en: Ribert who serves and China quickly receives the ball.
segments.cn: Ribert发球，中国迅速接到球。

segments.en: Chun bumps it to the center, and a very nice set by Chun.
segments.cn: Chun将球传到中间，Chun的传球非常漂亮。

segments.en: Shue spikes it.
segments.cn: Shue扣杀。

segments.en: Wow, what a great hit.
segments.cn: 哇，真是个精彩的击球。

segments.en: The Brazilian blockers anticipated the play and tried to block him, but he managed to get the ball in.
segments.cn: 巴西的拦网手预判了这个动作并试图拦住他，但他成功将球打入。

segments.en: Great play.
segments.cn: 精彩的表现。

segments.en: It's China's service now.
segments.cn: 现在是中国发球。

segments.en: What a superb jump serve by Li.
segments.cn: Li的跳发球真是太棒了。

segments.en: Oh, and we have a let's serve.
segments.cn: 哦，我们有一个“让球”。

segments.en: The ball was coming in fast and almost made it over the net.
segments.cn: 球飞得很快，差点越过了网。

segments.en: Brazil calls for a timeout, and we'll be right back after a short commercial break.
segments.cn: 巴西请求暂停，我们将在短暂的商业广告后回来。

segments.en: Well, sounds like a pretty exciting encounter between these two countries.
segments.cn: 听起来这两国之间的遭遇相当激动人心。

segments.en: Very good teams, and both of them, as they mentioned, are powerhouse teams.
segments.cn: 非常好的队伍，正如他们提到的，都是强队。

segments.en: Well, why don't we take a look at some of the vocabulary that we came across in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么我们不看看在这段对话中遇到的一些词汇呢？

segments.en: We're gonna be focusing on volleyball words here in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们将专注于排球词汇，在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: Okay, so in Language Takeaway today, we're gonna have six words, and let's start with the first one.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在语言收获中，我们将有六个词，让我们从第一个开始。

segments.en: Chen bumps it to the setter.
segments.cn: Chen将球传给传球手。

segments.en: Right, to bump.
segments.cn: 对，传球。

segments.en: All right, so in volleyball, when you are going to receive the ball, you put your arms together and you hit it with your forearms.
segments.cn: 在排球中，当你要接球时，你将双臂合并，用前臂击球。

segments.en: That's right, so at the top of your arm.
segments.cn: 没错，就是在手臂的上部。

segments.en: Right, and that's how you pass it to another player.
segments.cn: 对，这样你就可以将球传给另一个球员。

segments.en: That's called a bump.
segments.cn: 这叫做传球。

segments.en: So it is a noun and a verb.
segments.cn: 所以它既是名词也是动词。

segments.en: A bump to bump.
segments.cn: 传球，传球。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now another type of way to move the ball in volleyball we heard in the dialogue is a set.
segments.cn: 现在在对话中提到的另一种传球方式是传球。

segments.en: A very nice set by Chen.
segments.cn: Chen的传球非常漂亮。

segments.en: So a set or to set.
segments.cn: 所以传球或传球。

segments.en: Right, the word can be used as a verb and a noun.
segments.cn: 对，这个词可以用作动词和名词。

segments.en: And again, you take the ball and you move it with the tips of your fingers.
segments.cn: 再次，你用手指尖移动球。

segments.en: That is actually done by the setter.
segments.cn: 这实际上是由传球手完成的。

segments.en: Right, that is done by the setter.
segments.cn: 对，这由传球手完成。

segments.en: And he does this, he sets the ball so then the attacker can spike the ball.
segments.cn: 他这样做，传球给攻击手，以便攻击手可以扣杀。

segments.en: That's our next word, to spike.
segments.cn: 这是我们的下一个词，扣杀。

segments.en: So to spike the ball.
segments.cn: 所以扣杀球。

segments.en: Or a spike.
segments.cn: 或者一个扣杀。

segments.en: Is when you hit the ball very hard and very fast with the palm of your hand.
segments.cn: 是当你用手掌非常用力和快速地击打球。

segments.en: That's right, and that's how you score your points, right?
segments.cn: 没错，这就是你得分的方式，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, so you'll see three basic moves.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以你会看到三种基本动作。

segments.en: The bump, set, and spike.
segments.cn: 传球、传球和扣杀。

segments.en: But what about the serve?
segments.cn: 但是发球呢？

segments.en: Alright, so our fourth word in volleyball is service.
segments.cn: 好的，排球中的第四个词是发球。

segments.en: So it's China's service now.
segments.cn: 现在是中国发球。

segments.en: Right, so the service is the opportunity for the team to serve the ball.
segments.cn: 对，发球是球队发球的机会。

segments.en: Yeah, pretty simple.
segments.cn: 是的，非常简单。

segments.en: Right, and that means basically to start the game by hitting it to the other side.
segments.cn: 对，这基本上意味着通过将球击向另一侧来开始比赛。

segments.en: Now one type of serve is the jump serve.
segments.cn: 现在一种发球方式是跳发球。

segments.en: Jump serve.
segments.cn: 跳发球。

segments.en: Jump serve.
segments.cn: 跳发球。

segments.en: Now this is very popular and you will see some players do this.
segments.cn: 这非常流行，你会看到一些球员这样做。

segments.en: They will throw the ball in the air and then jump in the air and hit it.
segments.cn: 他们会将球抛向空中，然后跳起来击打它。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, so that's a jump serve.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是跳发球。

segments.en: And our last word for today is let's serve.
segments.cn: 今天我们的最后一个词是让球。

segments.en: A let's serve.
segments.cn: 一个让球。

segments.en: Okay, we have a let's serve today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们有一个让球。

segments.en: So a let's serve is when you serve the ball and it sort of brushes over the net.
segments.cn: 所以让球是当你发球时，球轻轻掠过网。

segments.en: Right, it'll hit the net but it will still pass to the other side.
segments.cn: 对，它会碰到网，但仍然会传到另一侧。

segments.en: That's right, and that's an illegal move in volleyball, isn't it?
segments.cn: 没错，这在排球中是一个非法动作，不是吗？

segments.en: When you are serving, yes.
segments.cn: 当你发球时，是的。

segments.en: So a let's serve.
segments.cn: 所以一个让球。

segments.en: Right, so those are the six terms related to volleyball that we're going to be looking at today.
segments.cn: 对，所以这些是我们今天要看的与排球相关的六个术语。

segments.en: And well, with this in mind, let's move on to looking at some phrases now in, what is it, Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么，考虑到这一点，让我们继续看看一些短语，现在在流利构建中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建。

segments.en: Alright, so our two announcers, Bob and Rick, said that we've got an exciting encounter ahead of us.
segments.cn: 好的，我们的两位解说员Bob和Rick说我们有一场激动人心的遭遇在前面。

segments.en: Right, so they use this phrase ahead of us.
segments.cn: 对，他们使用了这个短语在我们面前。

segments.en: Ahead of us.
segments.cn: 在我们面前。

segments.en: So basically, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 基本上，这意味着什么？

segments.en: Something will happen in the very near future.
segments.cn: 很快就会发生一些事情。

segments.en: So they are expecting it or they will encounter it maybe.
segments.cn: 所以他们在期待，或者可能会遇到。

segments.en: Yes, so why don't we give a few examples of this phrase.
segments.cn: 是的，那我们为什么不举几个这个短语的例子呢。

segments.en: Marco, we've got a long day ahead of us.
segments.cn: 马尔科，我们今天有很长的一天。

segments.en: We have a very exciting trip ahead of us today.
segments.cn: 我们今天有一个非常激动人心的旅行。

segments.en: Okay, so ahead of us.
segments.cn: 好的，前方有我们。

segments.en: So we know it's an exciting game and we heard the announcers say without a doubt both teams are in top shape.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道这是一个激动人心的比赛，我们听到解说员毫无疑问地说两队状态都很好。

segments.en: Okay, so the phrase without a doubt.
segments.cn: 好的，所以短语“毫无疑问”。

segments.en: Without a doubt.
segments.cn: 毫无疑问。

segments.en: So if I start a phrase using without a doubt.
segments.cn: 所以如果我用“毫无疑问”开始一个短语。

segments.en: You're basically saying there's no question.
segments.cn: 你基本上是在说没有问题。

segments.en: It's so obvious.
segments.cn: 这太明显了。

segments.en: This definitely is true.
segments.cn: 这绝对是真的。

segments.en: It's very true.
segments.cn: 这非常真实。

segments.en: Okay, so without a doubt, EnglishPod is the best podcast out there.
segments.cn: 好的，所以毫无疑问，EnglishPod是最好的播客。

segments.en: Without a doubt, this is the strategy we should take.
segments.cn: 毫无疑问，这是我们应该采取的策略。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So without a doubt, why don't we move on to our third phrase now.
segments.cn: 所以毫无疑问，我们现在为什么不继续我们的第三个短语呢。

segments.en: This will prove to be a competitive match.
segments.cn: 这将证明是一场竞争激烈的比赛。

segments.en: So let's look at the phrase will prove to be something will prove to be.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看短语“将证明是某事”。

segments.en: Okay, so before we get into it, why don't we listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们深入之前，为什么不听一些例子。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: And I think you will prove to be the greatest president we've ever had.
segments.cn: 我认为你将证明是我们有过的最伟大的总统。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: The new HR policy is proving to be a waste of time.
segments.cn: 新的人力资源政策证明是浪费时间。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: We were worried that we were going to get laid off, but our fears proved to be untrue.
segments.cn: 我们担心会被裁员，但我们的担忧证明是错误的。

segments.en: Okay, so when something will prove to be it will show itself to be this thing, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以当某事将证明是时，它将显示自己是这个东西，对吗？

segments.en: It will demonstrate.
segments.cn: 它将展示。

segments.en: We will see it.
segments.cn: 我们会看到它。

segments.en: We will see for sure how it will be.
segments.cn: 我们会确实看到它将会如何。

segments.en: And now for our fourth phrase, a very simple one, but very common in sports commentators or when you're watching a game.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的第四个短语，一个非常简单的，但在体育评论员或观看比赛时非常常见。

segments.en: You'll say great play.
segments.cn: 你会说精彩的表现。

segments.en: Great play.
segments.cn: 精彩的表现。

segments.en: Great play.
segments.cn: 精彩的表现。

segments.en: A great play.
segments.cn: 一次精彩的表现。

segments.en: Now we know play is usually a verb, right?
segments.cn: 现在我们知道“表现”通常是一个动词，对吗？

segments.en: But here it's acting as a noun.
segments.cn: 但在这里它作为名词使用。

segments.en: A play is basically a move in a sport or a game.
segments.cn: 一次表现基本上是体育或游戏中的一个动作。

segments.en: So when somebody says a great play it means all the succession of moves and passes and hits to make the point.
segments.cn: 所以当有人说一次精彩的表现时，它意味着所有的动作、传球和击球的连续过程以得分。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So it was a great play.
segments.cn: 所以这是一次精彩的表现。

segments.en: And you can use that for any sport.
segments.cn: 你可以在任何运动中使用这个。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to our dialogue now for the second time and then we'll come back and talk about this very popular sport, volleyball.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在为什么不再听一次我们的对话，然后我们再回来谈谈这个非常受欢迎的运动，排球。

segments.en: It's a beautiful day here in New Zealand at the men's volleyball world championship.
segments.cn: 新西兰男子排球世界锦标赛的今天是个美丽的日子。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and I'm joined by the man of the plan, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫瑞克·菲尔兹，我的搭档是计划之人，鲍勃·科普兰。

segments.en: Thank you, Rick.
segments.cn: 谢谢你，瑞克。

segments.en: We've got a very exciting encounter ahead of us today as two powerhouse teams, Brazil and China, face off against each other and try to qualify for the next round.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一场非常激动人心的对决，两支强队，巴西和中国，互相对抗，争取晋级下一轮。

segments.en: Without a doubt, both teams are in top shape and this will prove to be a competitive match.
segments.cn: 毫无疑问，两队状态都很好，这将证明是一场竞争激烈的比赛。

segments.en: The ref signals the start of the game and here we go.
segments.cn: 裁判发出比赛开始的信号，开始了。

segments.en: Ribeiro serves and China quickly receives the ball.
segments.cn: 里贝罗发球，中国迅速接到球。

segments.en: Chun bumps it to the center and a very nice set by Chun.
segments.cn: 春将球传到中间，春的传球非常漂亮。

segments.en: Shu spikes it.
segments.cn: 书猛扣。

segments.en: Wow, what a great hit.
segments.cn: 哇，真是一次精彩的击球。

segments.en: The Brazilian blockers anticipated the play and tried to block him, but he managed to get the ball in.
segments.cn: 巴西的拦网者预判了这个动作并试图拦住他，但他成功地将球打入。

segments.en: Great play.
segments.cn: 精彩的表现。

segments.en: It's China's service now.
segments.cn: 现在是中国的发球。

segments.en: What a superb jump serve by Lee.
segments.cn: 李的跳发球真是太棒了。

segments.en: Oh, oh, and we have a let's serve.
segments.cn: 哦，哦，我们有一个发球失误。

segments.en: The ball was coming in fast and almost made it over the net.
segments.cn: 球飞得很快，差点越过网。

segments.en: Brazil calls for a timeout and we'll be right back after a short commercial break.
segments.cn: 巴西请求暂停，我们将在短暂的广告后回来。

segments.en: So are you a volleyball fan, Marco?
segments.cn: 所以你是排球迷吗，马尔科？

segments.en: It's a very nice sport.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常好的运动。

segments.en: It's very fast and it's very hard.
segments.cn: 它非常快，非常难。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: But it's very interesting to get together with friends, maybe at the beach and play some beach volleyball or something like that.
segments.cn: 但和朋友们聚在一起，可能在海滩上打沙滩排球或类似的事情是非常有趣的。

segments.en: Yeah, I think that's the best place to play volleyball.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为那是打排球的最佳场所。

segments.en: And, you know, we even have beach volleyball up in freezing cold Canada.
segments.cn: 而且，你知道，我们甚至在寒冷的加拿大也有沙滩排球。

segments.en: And do you have sand?
segments.cn: 你们有沙子吗？

segments.en: Occasionally.
segments.cn: 偶尔有。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So volleyball is a great sport, but now we want to know what sport you want to learn about.
segments.cn: 所以排球是一个很棒的运动，但现在我们想知道你想了解什么运动。

segments.en: We've covered soccer, we've covered basketball, we've covered volleyball.
segments.cn: 我们已经涵盖了足球、篮球和排球。

segments.en: So tell us what other sports you would like to learn vocabulary and phrases on.
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们你还想学习哪些运动的词汇和短语。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You can tell us this and many more things at EnglishPod.com, our website.
segments.cn: 你可以在我们的官网EnglishPod.com告诉我们这些和更多的事情。

segments.en: So check it out.
segments.cn: 所以请查看一下。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Leave your questions and comments, and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 留下你的问题和评论，我们会在那里见到你们。

segments.en: Thanks for downloading.
segments.cn: 感谢下载。

segments.en: And until next time, goodbye.
segments.cn: 下次再见，再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
